item.title: Bitlife: How to Become a Pilot
item.description:
Bitlife is a fun text-based life simulation game where you get full control of your characters’ lives. In this free-to-play game, you make all the decisions for your character. For example, you can choose your degree, start a business, manage relationships, and even choose your character's birthplace.

When it comes to jobs and careers, there are plenty of options in Bitlife . If you're passionate about flying, you can become a pilot. However, for that, you will need to get a university degree and a pilot's license first. As difficult as the journey is, it’s one of the most lucrative jobs in the game. Read this guide to learn how to become a pilot in Bitlife.

How to Become a Pilot in Bitlife

To become a pilot in the game, you have to age up to 18 and complete your university degree . Some good degrees for this career include Engineering and Mathematics. Study hard every year to boost your intelligence, and avoid getting into fights or illegal activities. This will increase your chances of getting accepted into university.

After finishing your studies, your next step is to get a pilot's license . Just like in real life, a pilot's license requires you to attend a flight school and complete forty hours of flying. Keep in mind that each hour costs $145, so make sure you have $6,000 to $8,000 before proceeding. You can apply for part-time jobs to earn some money. To get the license in the game, click on Activities, go to the ‘Licenses' option, and tap on ‘Flight School’.

Once you complete all 40 hours, you can take the pilot's license test , which costs $1,000. If you fail, you will need to retake the test and pay another $1,000. This exam determines whether you are qualified to be a pilot or not. So completing the process and clearing the test can take some time.

During the test, you'll be asked profession-related questions. Upon passing, you’ll get your pilot license, and you will be able to apply for the job. For that, go to Occupation, select Jobs, and scroll down to find the ‘Pilot Trainee’ position. If the job isn't available yet, try again after aging up or restart the game.

Once the job appears, go through the interview process to secure your position as a pilot. As you progress in your career, you can request salary increases. This is how you can become a pilot in Bitlife.

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for May 29, 2024
item.description:
Strands has another letter grid to try to find a whole bunch of words in. If you are already familiar with the rules of how to play Strands , but you need help specifically with today's puzzle, know you aren't alone. Today's puzzle is a big challenge, and many will be looking for some help with this one.

In the article below, you can find all that help you need. Here, you can find general hints, word spoilers, the full answer to today's puzzle, and even an explanation for how the themed words and the clue work together.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #87 for May 29, 2024

Today's puzzle has seven items to find: one Spangram and six themed words. The clue for this one is A Good Workout .

New York Times Games Strands Clues

Searching for some hints that don't spoil any of the words? You can find three hints below, one in each of these expandable sections. They won't spoil the Spangram or any of the words in today's challenging puzzle.

General Hint 1

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

Below, you can find two word spoilers, one in each of the expandable sections. They hold one word spoiler and the location of that word in the Strands letter grid. These should help you solve this puzzle game if you are still stuck.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

If you are interested in seeing the full answer to today's puzzle, you can see it in the section below. Press the Read More button to see the Spangram, the themed words, and where each are in the letter grid.

Today's Strands Explained

Stuck on what the clue, the themed words, and the Spangram all mean in today's New York Times Games Strands ? In the section below, you can find an explanation of how all these work together.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: Warframe: How to Get Violet Archon Shards
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Get Archon Shards In Warframe
  • How To Get Violet Archon Shards In Warframe
  • Violet Archon Shard Statistics In Warframe

In Warframe , Archon Shards are special endgame items that enhance the exosuits abilities. Archon Shards were first introduced to the game as part of the Veilbreaker update. When slotted into the Warframes, these shards provide various buffs, including increased damage, greater health, and faster movement.

Archon Shards add a strategic dimension to the game, offering players the opportunity to tailor their Warframes for specific encounters. There are three standard variants of Archon Shards in the game, acquired by completing weekly challenges. Unlike the standard shards, however, Violet Archon Shards in Warframe are acquired by fusing two standard Archon Shards. The following guide aims to help players understand the process involved in acquiring these special shards and share details on their effectiveness.

How To Get Archon Shards In Warframe

Since Violet Archon Shards are obtained by fusing two standard Archon Shards, players must first learn how to acquire the standard Archon Shards in Warframe .

These shards can be earned after completing the Veilbreaker quest , which is available towards the endgame. The completion of the Veilbreaker quest opens a few avenues for players to earn standard Archon Shards.

There are three standard Archon Shards in Warframe : Crimson, Azure, and Amber . Additionally, players can sometimes also score a Tauforged Archon Shard, which is a stronger variant of the standard Archon Shard.

There are three sources of scoring these powerful items:

  • Weekly Purchase From Chipper: Chipper becomes available after players complete Kahl’s missions . Each week, players can visit Chipper and purchase one Archon Shard for 90 Stock . The shard cycles each week, and players do not have a choice of purchasing a specific variant of Archon Shard.
  • Weekly Archon Hunt: Players can earn Archon Shards by completing weekly Archon Hunts, which are special late-game missions that are guaranteed to reward an Archon Shard. Weekly Archon Hunts also have a chance of dropping Tauforged Shards.
  • Netracell Missions: Finally, after completing the Whispers of the Walls quest , players can pursue five random Netracell missions, each with the possibility of rewarding Archon Shards or Tauforged Archon Shards upon completion . There’s also a small possibility that players may not receive any Archon or Tauforged shards from completing Netracell missions.

How To Get Violet Archon Shards In Warframe

Unlike standard Archon Shards, Violet Archon Shards are produced by combining Crimson and Azure Archon Shards . However, the ability to fuse/combine Archon Shards isn’t readily available, and players must complete a few steps first, including purchasing an upgrade segment blueprint for the Helminth.

  • First, players must ensure that they complete the Veilbreaker quest and that their character is a Rank 2 – Researcher.
  • Next, travel to Sanctum Anatomica on Deimos .
  • Once players reach Sanctum Anatomica, they must fast travel to Bird 3 .
  • Interact with Bird 3 and browse through its offerings, looking specifically for the Helminth Coalescent Segment blueprint . The blueprint costs 30,000 Standing .

Now, players can return to the foundry to craft the Coalescent Segment upgrade by collecting the necessary resources and, once crafted, proceed to install it into the Helminth.

With the Coalescent Segment installed, players should notice a new option in the Hemlinth menu called Coalescent Fusion . Selecting the menu brings up a fusion UI where players can combine two standard Archon Shards to produce a new Archon Shard.

In the case of the Violet Archon Shard, players should fuse the Crimson and Azure Archon Shards. To produce an even more powerful variant, players can fuse a Crimson and Azure Tauforged Archon Shards to produce a Tauforged Violet Archon Shard. Similarly, players can fuse Amber and Azure Archon Shards to produce Emerald Archon Shard, and Crimson and Amber Archon Shards to produce Topaz Archon Shard.

Violet Archon Shard Statistics In Warframe

Like every other Archon Shard available in the game, the Violet Archon Shard also offers four buffs to enhance the Warframes capabilities:

  • Deal +10% (+15%) ability damage to enemies affected by electricity status.
  • Deal +30% (+45%) primary electricity damage and an additional +10% damage per crimson, azure, and violet shards equipped.
  • Deal +25% (+37.5%) melee critical damage. The damage output doubles (+50%) when the max energy is over 500.
  • Gain +20% (+30%) energy when picking up health and +20% health when picking up energy.

Values listed within the parenthesis refer to Tauforged Violet Archon Shard.

item.title: New York Times Connections Hints and Answers for #353 May 29, 2024
item.description:
Connections is a short daily word puzzle game from the New York Times Games. In order to win this challenging word puzzle game, you'll need to know a little about a lot of different subjects and categories.

If you already know the rules of how to play Connections , but you are stuck on today's puzzle, this article is for you. Here, you can find general hints to the whole puzzle, category clues and spoilers, and even the entire answer if you would like to see it. Check below for all the help you could ever need with today's Connections.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #353 for May 29, 2024

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Bully, Bull, Eats, Meat, Stock, Steer, Rattle, Guide, Fare, Cow, Chow, Lead, Grub, Direct, and Daunt.

What is the Definition of Daunt?

Daunt is a verb in English that means to "intimidate." Some synonyms for daunt, according to Dictionary.com are: "to frighten, dismay, subdue, overawe. To lessen the courage of; dishearten."

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle #353 for May 29, 2024

If you are looking for some clues that won't spoil the entire puzzle, check out the sections below. Each one contains some hints for today's New York Times Games Connections puzzle.

Some General Hints for the Whole Connections Puzzle 353

More Guides

Honkai: Star Rail may look like a typical turn-based game, but with the gorgeous character design and large areas to explore, it's bound to keep players entertained for hours of gameplay. The combat starts off easy, but will slowly get harder as the game progress, which means it's necessary to properly raise the Trailblazer's party and always keep up with the best equipment.

Here, players can easily access the available Honkai: Star Rail character guides, which include builds, team compositions, Light Cone ranking, and level-up materials. Some tips for harder content like the Simulated Universe are also listed at the bottom section.

This page will constantly be updated with new releases of character guides, so make sure to check back often!
